byline.contributor: Adam Nossiter contributed reporting from Dakar, Senegal, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Videos and other media releases from Nigerian Islamist group Boko Haram have suddenly become more professional, showing signs of affiliation with Islamic State; American officials say change does not necessarily mean groups are allied, but experts point out that jihadist groups in other countries made similar improvements after being accepted as branches of Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: The Nigerian terrorist group has begun using the flag, anthem and production style associated with ISIS.

headline.main: In Newly Sophisticated Boko Haram Videos, Hints of Islamic State Ties
headline.print_headline: In Newly Sophisticated Boko Haram Videos, Hints of Islamic State Ties

snippet: The Nigerian terrorist group has begun using the flag, anthem and production style associated with ISIS.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
